Flight Tracker

A local airport in India wanted to enable their passengers to track flights and get informed about the time to check-in. This was the initial phase of enabling the airport to become a smart airport.

Problem

As part of their grand plan to become a smart airport, the clients wanted to empower their guests. Empowered to do much more than what they did then, giving them access to real-time information. Real-time information about their flights, shops and restaurants.

Research

Talking with travellers who use the airport to understand how they would access information about the airport and the flights. Identifying potential opportunity areas where we can bring in value.

Analysis & Insights

Identifying different personas who are using the airport and narrowing them to two target user groups who would potentially become the early adopters of the platform we are building.

Initial Offering

Real time flight tracking was identified as the initial offering for the super commuter on the platform via an app. The app would also provide the users with shopping and refreshment information for the relaxed explorer traveller.

Modes of Search

Three modes of searching for the flights were arrived at to land onto the flight to track. Of which, search by departure-destination pair and by flight number were prioritised.

User testing

Multiple rounds of user testing were conducted with the target user groups to understand their preferences at different points in time of their travel and incorporating their feedback into the app.

Continous design and user testing cycles were run to distill the experience of tracking to the core flow.

Tracking Flights

Modes by which passengers can search and track the flights.

1. Search by flight number

2. Search by destination & airline

Design System

To maintain consistency across the platform, a design system was developed in place to efficiently reuse design. The initial design system iteratively evolved over time.
